nodes.text: The SPINDLE chamber floor smells like old coolant and new paperwork. (pause) A dull containment sphere sits at center. (pause) Three rotating frames circle it—maintenance markings on each disagree by a decade. (pause) Near the approach, witness-marker tape makes a neat legal shape on the floor. (pause) It matches no safety standard you recognize. It matches a form.

You take one last look across the floor—the sphere, the lights, the tape. (pause)
It still pretends it’s just tape. (pause)
Then you head for the stairs down to the observation deck. (pause)
The hum follows you—consistent as a policy.

You take one last look at the witness perimeter, (pause) like it might move when you aren’t watching. (pause) It doesn’t. (pause)
You head for the stairs down to the observation deck. (pause) The hum follows you, consistent as a policy.

You angle back toward the overflow intake concourse. (pause)
The chamber stays behind you, quietly maintaining its version of “normal.”
You angle back toward the overflow intake concourse—tape line fixed in your mind. (pause) A procedural edge. The chamber stays behind you, quietly maintaining its version of “normal.”
